alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:35PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A couple brief funnel clouds are possible over portions of southeastern Chase, northeastern Butler and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 133 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles south of Cottonwood Falls. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Brief funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Rosalia, Cassoday, Matfield Green, Thrall, El Dorado State Park and El Dorado Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 82 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
